title: High Reliance on Short-term Debt
description: In 2023, Lebanon's short-term debt reached 135.71% of its exports of goods, services, and primary income, indicating a significant reliance on short-term borrowing.

title: Substantial Net ODA Received
description: In 2022, Lebanon received net official development assistance amounting to 554.48% of its gross capital formation, highlighting a heavy dependence on foreign aid.

title: Minimal PM2.5 Pollution Exposure
description: In 2017, only a negligible percentage of Lebanon's population was exposed to PM2.5 pollution levels exceeding WHO's Interim Target-1 value, showcasing effective air quality management.

title: High Household Consumption Expenditure
description: In 2022, household and NPISHs final consumption expenditure accounted for 140.38% of Lebanon's GDP, indicating a strong consumer spending culture.

title: Low Private Sector Investment
description: In 2022, gross fixed capital formation by the private sector was only 1.17% of GDP, reflecting limited private investment in the economy.

title: Negative Growth in Capital Formation
description: Lebanon experienced an -88.59% annual decline in gross fixed capital formation in 2022, indicating a severe contraction in investment activities.

title: Minimal Gross Capital Formation
description: In 2022, gross capital formation was only 1.23% of GDP, highlighting a lack of investment in capital assets.

title: Shrinking Industrial Sector
description: In 2022, the industry sector, including construction, contributed just 2.39% to Lebanon's GDP, indicating a declining industrial base.

title: Negative Gross Domestic Savings
description: In 2022, Lebanon's gross domestic savings were negative, amounting to -252.28 trillion LCU, reflecting a lack of savings within the economy.

title: Negative Gross Savings
description: Lebanon's gross savings were negative in 2022, with a value of -4.41 billion USD, indicating a severe savings deficit.

title: High Refugee Population
description: In 2023, Lebanon hosted 490,636 refugees under the UNRWA mandate, reflecting the country's significant role in providing asylum.
